III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Intervention standards and prohibitions.
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Description policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention:
(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not limited to:
(ii) Hitting or striking, throwing, kicking, pulling, or pushing a
youth on any part of their body.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation On 10/13/2024, youth took staff member’s keys from him and then
assaulted him. Staff retaliated and hit youth several times in the
abdomen resulting in medical attention being sought for both. Staff
sustained a bloody nose and knot on his head. He will be placed
on leave until an investigation is conducted. Youth was not
observed with any marks, bruises or injuries.
Investigation Interviews
Complainant was interviewed on 10/23/2024. Complainant does
not have additional information.
Youth A was interviewed on 10/18/2024 at Wayne County
Juvenile Detention with another Department of Health and Human
Service (DHHS) worker. Youth A stated he does not recall the
physical interaction between him and Staff 1. Youth A does not
recall if he hit Staff 1 and denied being hit by Staff 1. Youth A told
Division of Child Welfare Licensing Consultant and DHHS worker
to watch the video for details of the physical contact between him,
Youth B and Staff 1. Youth A said, “I smoked a lot of weed”, as the
reason for not remembering the details of the 10/13/2024 incident
involving him, Youth B and Staff 1. Youth A stated Staff 1 is a
“good guy” and “did not mean any harm.”
Youth B was interviewed on 10/18/2024 at his current placement.
Youth B stated he was in the shower stall getting ready to shower
when he heard Youth A and Staff 1 argue and throw punches.
Youth B stated he stepped out of the shower stall to separate
Youth A and Staff 1 because Youth A is “a short guy” and Staff 1
is “big with muscles”. Youth B stated Youth A punched Staff 1 in
the face. Youth B stated Staff 1 faced Youth A, wrapped his arms
around Youth A’s upper body as Youth A was bent over at the
2

waist and then punched Youth A. Youth B stated Staff 1 directed
Youth B to move away. Youth B stated Youth A went to the
ground and Staff 1 hovered over Youth A and he could not see
what happened. Youth B stated he told Youth A and Staff 1 to
stop and tried grabbing Youth A from under Staff 1. Youth B
stated Staff 1 turned around “like a raging bull” and pushed Youth
B. Youth B stated he became angry and punched Staff 1. Youth B
stated he asked Staff 1, “Why you push me? I’m trying to stop it. I
didn’t want to do that.” Youth B stated Staff 1 did not respond but
shifted his focus from Youth A to Youth B. Youth B stated he
backed into a table and slipped onto the ground. Youth B stated
Staff 1 grabbed Youth B by the shirt, got on top of him and
punched Youth B’s head. Youth B stated Youth A got on top of
Staff 1 and started to punch Staff 1. Youth B stated he grabbed
Staff 1’s arm, released himself, got up and ran. Youth B stated
Staff 1 dropped his keys when he chased after Youth B. Youth B
stated Staff 1 said, “I’m gonna one off one of you niggas … kill
you … this for $60,000.00 job.” Youth B stated Youth A unlocked
youth room doors with Staff 1’s keys. Youth B stated one of the
youths came out of his room and swung repeatedly at Youth B.
Youth B stated Supervisor 1 arrived on the unit and placed Youth
B in the vestibule and the incident ended. Youth B said, “It wasn’t
supposed to go down like this.” Staff 1 “is like a Pops to me.”
Youth B stated Staff 1 was injured with a bloody nose in this
incident. Youth B stated he apologized to Staff 1 at least four
times later that night. Youth B stated the next morning he was
worried about his safety because Staff 1 is well liked and some
youths threatened him. Youth B stated he expressed his concern
with Supervisor 2 and was transferred to another unit without
incident.
Youth C was interviewed on 10/23/2024 at Wayne County
Juvenile Detention with another DHHS worker. Youth C stated
Staff 1 and Youth A have a “love-hate relationship” and he heard
them argue when Staff 1 opened Youth A’s room door for
showers. Youth C stated from his room door window he saw Staff
1 wrap his arms around Youth A. Youth C stated Youth B
approached them and swung at Staff 1. Youth C stated Staff 1 let
go of Youth A, grabbed Youth B and took Youth B to the ground.
Youth C denied seeing anything else until Youth A opened his
room door with Staff 1’s keys. Youth C stated he exited his room
and swung on Youth B for hitting Staff 1. Youth C stated he and
Youth B went to the ground, got up and chased each other on the
unit. Youth C stated the incident ended when assistance arrived.
Youth C stated Staff 1 had a nosebleed and possibly a bloody lip
from this incident.
3

Youth D was interviewed on 10/23/2024 at Wayne County
Juvenile Detention with another DHHS worker. Youth D stated
Staff 1 is a “cool staff”. Youth D stated he was in his room using
the tablet when he looked out his room door window and saw
Youth B talking to Staff 1 in the common area. Youth D stated
Youth B called Staff 1 out of his name (does not recall the words
said). Youth D denied seeing Youth A in the common area. Youth
D denied seeing a physical incident between Youth A, Youth B
and Staff 1.
Youth E was interviewed on 10/23/2024 at Wayne County
Juvenile Detention with another DHHS worker. Youth E stated
during shower time he heard a loud noise and saw Staff 1 and
Youth A “slap boxing” in the common area. Youth E stated Staff 1
is like “a big brother” and did not think much of the incident. Youth
E stated Staff 1 grabbed Youth A and may have caused Youth B
to hit the wall when he tried to move Youth B away from them.
Youth E stated Youth B took off his socks and approached Staff 1.
Youth E stated Staff 1 hit Youth B in the chest and Youth B threw
“haymakers,” a powerful punch, at Staff 1. Youth E stated one of
Youth B’s punches connected with Staff 1’s face and caused Staff
1’s nose to bleed. Youth E stated Supervisor 1 came onto the unit
and grabbed Staff 1 away from Youth A and Youth B. Youth E
stated Supervisor 1 placed Youth B in the vestibule and the
incident ended.
Youth F was interviewed on 10/23/2024 at Wayne County
Juvenile Detention with another DHHS worker. Youth F stated his
name is “John Doe”. Youth F did not acknowledge his given
name. Youth F stated he does not know Youth A and does not
know Youth B.
Staff 1 was interviewed on 11/06/2024 at Wayne County Juvenile
Detention with another DHHS worker. Staff 1 stated Staff 2 was
on break when he accompanied Nurse passing out medication.
Staff 1 stated Youth A took his medications and came out of his
room to take a shower. Staff 1 stated Youth A was upset because
he went to his room last for shower time, which then placed him
last to shower, instead of his preference to shower first. Staff 1
stated Youth A “may have” hit him and he tried to do a primary
restraint technique hold on Youth A. Staff 1 stated Youth B, who
was showering, came out of the shower and hit Staff 1. Staff 1
stated he received a nosebleed and was “halfway unconscious”
from Youth B’s punch. Staff 1 stated he did not try to secure Youth
B in a primary restraint technique hold. Staff 1 stated Youth A
4

obtained his keys when they fell out of his pocket and Youth A
opened multiple youth room doors. Staff 1 stated Supervisor 1 and
other staff arrived on the unit and escorted youths back to their
rooms. Staff 1 stated Youth A and Youth B apologized to him after
the incident. Staff 1 stated his radio was in his pocket during the
incident, but he did not call for assistance. Staff 1 stated he does
not know when Nurse left the unit. Staff 1 stated he was mandated
to work and did not leave Unit 3D until 2:00 AM or 3:00 AM. Staff
1 stated he does not recall what happened between Youth A,
Youth B and the youths that exited their rooms.
Staff 2 was interviewed on 10/30/2024 at Wayne County Juvenile
Detention with another DHHS worker. Staff 2 stated during her
break she heard an assistance call for Unit 3D and returned to
Unit 3D. Staff 2 stated Youth B was in the vestibule “full of
adrenaline” when she arrived. Staff 2 stated Youth B said, “I
messed up” in referencing the incident on the unit. Staff 2 did not
have further information.
Supervisor 1 was interviewed on 11/06/2024 at Wayne County
Juvenile Detention with another DHHS worker. Supervisor 1
stated he found Staff 1 with facial bleeding and youths out of their
rooms when he responded to an assistance call on Unit 3D.
Supervisor 1 stated Staff 1 told him that Youth A and another
youth punched him and his keys fell out of his pocket, which
allowed a youth to open youth room doors. Supervisor 1 stated
Staff 1 refused medical attention and he directed Staff 1 to take a
break, write an incident report and head home. Supervisor 1
stated the youths were placed back in their rooms for the night
without further incident.
Nurse was interviewed 12/02/2024 by phone. Nurse stated she
was on Unit 3D passing medication with Staff 1’s support. Nurse
stated Youth A exited his room after taking his medication and
swung and hit Staff 1. Nurse stated Youth B approached and tried
to help Staff 1 with Youth A and then tried to help Youth A with
Staff 1. Nurse stated she pushed Unit 3D’s intercom to get staff
assistance but ended up using her cell phone to call for staff
assistance due to a delay in response from Master Control. Nurse
stated she left the unit when Youth A used Staff 1’s keys to open
youth room doors because Master Control unlocked the unit’s
entrance and exit door for her. Nurse stated nursing staff are not
trained in Handle with Care physical management.
Manager was interviewed on 10/23/2024 at Wayne County
Juvenile Detention with another DHHS worker. Manager stated
5

Staff 1 is removed from the schedule pending investigation.
Manager confirmed Youth B was transferred to another unit to
diffuse the tension between Unit 3D youths.
Video
Unit 3D 10/13/2024 video footage was reviewed from multiple
camera angles from approximately 8:30 PM to 8:45 PM. Video
recordings do not have sound. Video footage shows Staff 1 holds
Youth A’s door open as Nurse dispenses his medication. Youth A
exits his room and talks with Staff 1. Staff 1 opens the next youth’s
room door for medication dispensing. Youth A walks up and
reaches towards Staff 1’s left pant pocket. Staff 1 immediately
pushes the youth, who is getting his medication, back into his
room and closes the door. Staff 1 moves towards Youth A. Staff 1
and Youth A begin to swing their arms at each other with some
physical contact. From the other side of the unit Youth B walks up
to Youth A and Staff 1, who are now talking without swinging their
arms. Youth B stands between Youth A and Staff 1 with his back
towards Staff 1. Youth A uses his right hand and hits Staff 1 in the
face and runs to other side of the unit with Staff 1 and Youth B
running after him. Youth A and Staff 1 face each other with their
arms entwined. Youth A punches Staff 1. Youth B’s arms are
stretched over Staff 1’s back as if to pull him away from Youth A.
Youth B then moves to the side of Youth A and Staff 1 and tries to
wedge his arm between them. Youth A and Staff 1 separate and
Youth B pushes Youth A away from Staff 1. Youth A and Staff 1
posture to fight again as they walk back to the other side of the
unit. Youth B stands at the staff desk and rests his head on his
arms on the staff desk watching Youth A and Staff 1 talk.
Video footage shows Nurse standing by the medication cart
observing Youth A, Youth B and Staff 1. Youth A approaches Staff
1 and hits Staff 1’s left arm. Staff 1’s keys fall to the ground when
he places and pulls his right hand out of his pant pocket and
moves towards Youth A. Staff 1 faces Youth A and wraps his
arms over Youth A's backside and under Youth A’s armpits while
Youth A is bent over facing Staff 1. Youth B repeatedly punches
Staff 1 on his back and also hits the back of Staff 1’s head. Youth
A, Youth B and Staff 1 separate and posture to fight again. Staff 1
swings at Youth A and then moves towards Youth B. Youth B
walks backwards into a stool attached to a table and stumbles to
the ground. Staff 1 goes to the ground on top of Youth B and
punches Youth B multiple times in the head and possibly his
upper body. Youth A punches Staff 1’s back multiple times until
they pause and all stand up. Youth A and Youth B skip to the
other side of the unit and Staff 1 walks to the staff desk.
6

Video footage shows Youth A begins to unlock youth room doors.
Youth B throws the logbook at Staff 1. Youth B then swipes an
object off the sink counter towards Staff 1. Youth B and Staff 1
posture with their arms in position to fight. Youth B and Staff 1
exchange words at the staff desk. Youths in the common area
approach the staff desk. Youth C walks up to Youth B and
punches him multiple times. The left side of Youth B’s head hits
the base of the staff desk as he and Youth C go to the ground.
Assistance arrives on the unit and separate Youth B and Youth C.
Staff 1 walks past Youth A and retrieves his keys.
Documentation
Staff 1 wrote an incident report dated 10/13/2024. It states around
8:30 PM Staff 1 assisted in medication dispensing. Youth A
received his medication and headed to the showers. Youth A was
upset about not showering first and punched Staff 1 in the head
and neck. Youth B exited the shower and started to assault Staff
1. Youth B prevented Staff 1 from placing Youth A in primary
restraint technique hold. Master control called for staff assistance.
Staff 1 continued to redirect and block the punches. Staff 1 tried to
walk Youth A to his room, but they went to the ground. Youth A
and Youth B punched Staff 1. Youth A picked up Staff 1’s keys
from the ground and let youths out of their rooms. Youths were
upset with Youth B for punching Staff 1 and they assaulted Youth
B. Additional staff came to the unit and escorted youths to their
room. Staff 1 is escorted off the unit.
Staff 1 was hired on 02/12/2024. Staff 1 completed Handle with
Care training on 02/14/2024 and 02/15/2024. Staff 1 does not
have a discipline history.
Unit 3D
Unit 3D has two entrance and exit doors. Upon entering the unit, a
classroom is located between the two entrance and exit doors. A
sink counter adjoins the front classroom wall and a staff desk runs
parallel in front of the sink counter. Across from the staff desk is
the unit gym. The unit has two shower stalls located in the far-right
corner on the same wall as the entrance and exit doors upon
entering the unit. Youth rooms surround the common area of the
unit to the right and left of the staff desk.
Analysis The agency is found in noncompliance when Staff 1 engaged in a
physical altercation that involved hitting and pushing Youth A and
Youth B.
7

TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
Staff 1 failed to use his radio to call for assistance in this incident.
Staff are to be trained to call for assistance before initiating
physical intervention with a youth.
Conclusion REPEAT VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
2024SIC0001771 Corrective action plan pending
Rule Code Sufficiency of staff.
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4126
Section The licensee shall have a sufficient number of administrative,
Description supervisory, social service, direct care and other staff on duty to
perform the prescribed functions required by these administrative
rules and in the agency’s program statement and to provide for
the continual needs, protection and supervision of residents.
Violation Additional Finding
Type
Investigation Interviews
Staff 1 was interviewed on 11/06/2024 at Wayne County Juvenile
Detention with another DHHS worker. Staff 1 stated his radio was
in his pocket during the incident, but he did not call for assistance.
Video
Unit 3D 10/13/2024 video footage was reviewed from multiple
camera angles from approximately 8:30 PM to 8:45 PM. Video
recordings do not have sound. Video footage shows Youth C
walks up to Youth B and punches him multiple times by the staff
desk. The left side of Youth B’s head hits the base of the staff
desk as he and Youth C go to the ground. Staff 1 stands between
the staff desk and sink counter. Assistance arrives on the unit and
the incident ends.
Analysis The agency is found in noncompliance in providing for the needs,
protection and supervision of youths when Staff 1 did not call for
assistance or physically intervene when Youth C physically
assaulted Youth B.
Conclusion VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
8

Rule Code R 400.4163 Health status assessment; notification;
Title debriefing; reporting.
Rule Code & (1) The agency shall develop and implement written procedures
Section for health status screening, notifications, debriefing, and reporting
Description when a restraint, including an emergency restraint, or seclusion is
used.
Violation Additional Finding
Type
Investigation Interviews
Youth A was interviewed on 10/18/2024 at Wayne County
Juvenile Detention with another DHHS worker. Youth A stated he
was not injured in this incident.
Youth B was interviewed on 10/18/2024 at his current placement.
Youth B stated the area around his left eye was bruised and
slightly swollen and his right eye especially hurt, due to a bullet
fragment from a previous incident in the community, but was not
seen by Nurse following the incident. Youth B stated the bruising,
swelling and pain have mostly subsided. Youth B was observed
with mild bruising above his right eye near his hairline.
Youth C was interviewed on 10/23/2024 at Wayne County
Juvenile Detention with another DHHS worker. Youth C stated he
and Youth A were not injured in this incident. Youth C stated
Youth B said his eye hurt and may have injured his eye in this
incident.
Supervisor 1 was interviewed on 11/06/2024 at Wayne County
Juvenile Detention with another DHHS worker. Supervisor 1
stated he believes the youths involved were assessed by a nurse
because it is protocol after a physical incident, however, he did not
recall who called for a nurse.
Nurse was interviewed on 12/02/2024 by phone. Nurse stated she
was not called to assess any youth on Unit 3D after the incident
involving Staff 1 on 10/13/2024.
Documentation
Unit 3D 10/13/2024 logbook does not document youths being
evaluated following the physical altercations.
Medical progress notes for Youth A and Youth B dated
10/13/2024 or 10/14/2024 for the physical altercation with Staff 1
9

were not found per Deputy Director’s email response on
10/28/2024.
Wayne County Juvenile Detention policy and procedure section
Physical Management 10.1 states “Health Status Assessment;
notification; debriefing; reporting (1) Health status screening of the
youth will occur immediately after seclusion or restraint by staff
assigned to this screening, as defined in agency policy.”
Analysis The agency is found in noncompliance by not having Youth A and
Youth B evaluated by a nurse following their physical contact with
Staff 1 on 10/13/2024.
Conclusion VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
Rule Code Program statement.
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4109
Section (1) An institution shall have and follow a current written program
Description statement which specifically address all of the following:
(c) Policies and procedures pertaining to admission, care,
safety and supervision methods for addressing residents’
needs, implementation of treatment plans and discharge of
residents.
Violation Additional Finding
Type
Investigation Documentation
Unit 3D logbook dated 10/13/2024 from 3:00 PM to 1:45 AM was
reviewed. It states Staff 1 and Staff 3 are on duty with 15 youths
on the unit. Logbook entries relevant to this investigation are listed
below.
• 4:00 PM Staff 2 takes the place of Staff 3 on Unit 3D.
Written by Staff 1.
• 7:00 PM Showers start. Written by Staff 2.
• 7:35 PM Staff 2 takes a break. Written by Staff 2. (This time
is written over and may be incorrect.)
• 7:55 PM to 9:30 PM There is no logbook documentation.
• 9:31 PM Showers resume. Written by Staff 2.
• 9:32 PM to 11:00 PM There is no logbook documentation.
• 11:00 PM Staff 1 is back on the unit and completes visual
round. Written by Staff 1.
• * (Time is not stated, but asterisk notation is around 1:45
AM.) Staff 4 relieves Staff 1. (Entry is not initialed.)
10

Logbook documentation does not state the following:
• Incident between Youth A, Youth B and Staff 1.
• Time Staff 2 returns from break.
• Time Staff 1 leaves the unit after the incident.
• Time Staff 2 completes and leaves her shift.
Wayne County Juvenile Detention policy and procedure section
Documentation and Logs 10.2 states “If there are any unusual
circumstances, those should also be noted. There must be an
entry every 30 minutes if residents are on the pod. If there has
been no activity, that should be stated.”
Analysis The agency is found in noncompliance for not completing Unit 3D
logbook documentation on 10/13/2024 from 7:55 PM to 9:30 PM
and from 9:32 PM to 11:00 PM. Logbook also does not include an
entry about Youth A, Youth B and Staff 1’s incident.
TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
Assigned staff’s time on and time off (e.g. work shift, breaks,
incident report writing etc.) the unit is to be documented in the
logbook for record keeping.
Supervisor presence and utility staff’s time on and time off the unit
is to be documented in the logbook for record keeping.
Logbook entries are to include the author of the entry.
CONSULTATION
Logbook documentation error is to be crossed out in a single
horizontal line and initialed by the person noting the error.
Conclusion REPEAT VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
2024SIC0001771 Corrective action plan pending
2024SIC0001797 Corrective action plan pending
Rule Code Staff to resident ratio.
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4127
Section (1) The licensee shall develop and adhere to a written staff to
Description resident ratio formula for direct care worker.
Violation Additional Finding
Type
11

Investigation Interviews
Staff 1 was interviewed on 11/06/2024 at Wayne County Juvenile
Detention with another DHHS worker. Staff 1 stated showers start
at 7:00 PM and bedtime is 9:00 PM.
Staff 2 was interviewed on 10/30/2024 at Wayne County Juvenile
Detention with another DHHS worker. Staff 2 stated Supervisor 1
may have given her approval to take a break when youths were in
their rooms for shower time on 10/13/2024.
Supervisor 1 was interviewed on 11/06/2024 at Wayne County
Juvenile Detention with another DHHS worker. Supervisor 1
stated he gave Staff 2 approval to take her break on 10/13/2024.
Supervisor 1 stated afternoon shift staff typically take their breaks
between 7:00 PM to 9:00 PM during youth shower time.
Documentation
10/13/2024 was a Sunday. Unit 3D’s weekend evening schedule
from 6:00 PM to 9:30 PM is listed below.
• 6:30pm-8:00pm Showers/Leisure/Phone calls/Snack
• 8:00pm-9:00pm Medication Dispensing/Group Check Out
• 8:00pm Level 1 Bedtime (successful day extend by 30
minutes)
• 8:30pm Level 2 Bedtime (successful day extend by 30
minutes)
• 9:00pm Level 3 Bedtime (successful day extend by 30
minutes)
• 9:30pm Level 4 Bedtime
Unit 3D logbook dated 10/13/2024 stated the following:
• 4:00 PM 15 youths on the unit with Staff 1 and Staff 2.
Written by Staff 1.
• 7:00 PM Showers start. Written by Staff 2.
• 7:35 PM Staff 2 takes a break. Written by Staff 2. (This time
is written over and may be incorrect.)
• 7:55 PM to 9:30 PM There is no logbook documentation.
• 9:31 PM Showers resume. Written by Staff 2.
• 9:32 PM to 11:00 PM There is no logbook documentation.
• 11:00 PM Staff 1 is back on the unit and completes visual
round. Written by Staff 1.
Wayne County Juvenile Detention’s policy and procedure titled
Zero Tolerance of Sexual Harassment, Assault and or Abuse 13.1
states “Requirements for Staff Supervision of Resident and Staff-
to Resident ratios always apply with Staff to Resident ratio during
12

waking hours no greater than 1:8 and Staff to Resident ratio
during non-waking hours no greater than 1:20.”
Analysis The agency is found in noncompliance of staff to youth ratio when
Staff 2 took her break on 10/13/2024 leaving Staff 1 with Nurse
dispensing medication and facilitating showers with 15 youths on
the unit.
Conclusion REPEAT VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
2024SIC0001736 Corrective action plan pending
Rule Code Seclusion within secure and nonsecure facilities; seclusion
Title plan; prohibitions; reduction and elimination.
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4162
Section (11) All seclusion will be prohibited effective November 1, 2022.
Description
Violation Additional Finding
Type
Investigation Interviews
Staff 1 was interviewed on 11/06/2024 at Wayne County Juvenile
Detention with another DHHS worker. Staff 1 stated he facilitated
showers and medication dispensing on 10/13/2024 on Unit 3D.
Staff 2 was interviewed on 10/30/2024 at Wayne County Juvenile
Detention with another DHHS worker. Staff 2 stated she usually
takes her lunch break when youths are in their rooms during
shower time.
Video
Unit 3D 10/13/2024 video footage was reviewed from multiple
camera angles from approximately 8:30 PM to 8:45 PM. Video
recordings do not have sound. Video shows Staff 1 assisting
Nurse in medication dispensing before the physical altercations.
Youths are seen standing in their room and looking out their room
door window during the physical altercation between Youth A,
Youth B and Staff 1. Youth A unlocks youth room doors after
picking up Staff 1’s keys from the ground and the youths exit their
room to the unit’s common areas.
Documentation
Wayne County Juvenile Detention requested a variance to use
seclusion when a youth becomes an imminent danger to self or
others and de-escalation techniques have failed. This variance
was approved by Division of Child Welfare Licensing Director. The
13

initial seclusion variance was requested on 08/26/2024 and
approved with a 10/26/2024 expiration date. A second seclusion
variance was requested on 10/23/2024 and approved with a
12/23/2024 expiration date. A third seclusion variance was
requested on 12/20/2024 and approved with a 02/20/2025
expiration date.
Analysis The agency is found in noncompliance for secluding youths in
their rooms during shower time on 10/13/2024 on Unit 3D. This is
outside the parameters of their approved variance.
Conclusion VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Due to the violations in this report a CAP is required.
